title: Mary Sidney Herbert, Countess of Pembroke
itunes:title: Mary Sidney Herbert, Countess of Pembroke
description:
She was a patron of the arts, the first woman to publish an English-language play, and the first woman to publish pastoral poetry. Mary Sidney Herbert was also incredibly wily when it came to navigating the limitations and possibilities of being a woman in 16th century England.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
content:encoded:
She was a patron of the arts, the first woman to publish an English-language play, and the first woman to publish pastoral poetry. Mary Sidney Herbert was also incredibly wily when it came to navigating the limitations and possibilities of being a woman in 16th century England.

itunes:keywords: Women, biographies, 16th century, 17th century, writers, poets, William Shakespeare, Queen Elizabeth I, Sir Philip Sidney, translators, smallpox, sexism
